dm

Class Ms

  • java.lang.Object
    • dm.Ms
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Key_H

    public class Ms
extends java.lang.Object
implements Key_H
    The Ms class implements the Key_H interface and provides various utility methods for handling byte arrays, images, sprites, and key events. It also includes methods for mathematical calculations and record store operations.

    Class Dependencies:

    • Key_H - Interface that this class implements.
    • Font - Used for font-related operations.
    • Random - Used for generating random numbers.
    • RecordStore - Used for record store operations.
    • Image - Used for image-related operations.
    • Sprite - Used for sprite-related operations.
    • DataInputStream - Used for reading data streams.
    • ByteArrayOutputStream - Used for writing byte arrays.
    • ByteArrayInputStream - Used for reading byte arrays.
    • Vector - Used for dynamic array operations.
    • StringBuffer - Used for string manipulation.

    Usage:

    This class provides a variety of static and instance methods for different operations:

    • Mathematical operations: abs, compare_min, mathPercent, mathSpeedDown, mathSpeedN, mathSpeedUp, sqrt
    • Byte array operations: byteArrayToShortArray, create2Array, create3Array, create4Array, createArray, createIntArray, createShort2Array, createShort3Array, createShortArray, shortArrayToByteArray
    • Image operations: createCellImage, createImage, createImageArray, createImageArray_, createImage_
    • Sprite operations: createSprite, setSprite
    • String operations: createString2Array, createStringArray, createStringArrayOne, equals, getDialogs, getStringWidth, groupString
    • Key event operations: keyRelease, key_Down, key_Left, key_Left_Right, key_Num0, key_Num1, key_Num3, key_Num9, key_Right, key_S1, key_S1_Num5, key_S2, key_Up, key_Up_Down, key_delay, runDelay
    • Record store operations: rmsOptions, setRmsInit
    • Miscellaneous operations: checkIsSimulate, correctSelect, getEventNowData, getInt, getLen_byte, getLen_short, getMin, getPrecision, getShort, getSleep, isRect, loadText, putInt, putShort, readEventNowData, select, selectS, sleep

    Initialization:

    The class initializes some static variables in a static block:

    • random - Initialized with a new Random instance.
    • font - Initialized with a specific font.
    • key_delay - Initialized to 0.
    • key_time - Initialized to 10.

    Singleton Instance:

    The class maintains a singleton instance msListener which can be accessed using the i() method.

    Example Usage:

    
 Ms msInstance = Ms.i();
 int absoluteValue = Ms.abs(-5);
 Image image = msInstance.createImage("example");
    See Also:
    Key_H, Font, Random, RecordStore, Image, Sprite, DataInputStream, ByteArrayOutputStream, ByteArrayInputStream, Vector, StringBuffer
